tiaraHssiMib.name: tiaraHssiMib
tiaraHssiMib.contactinfo: Tiara Networks Customer Support 525 Race Street, Suite 100, San Jose, CA 95126 USA Tel: +1 408-216-4700 Fax: +1 408-216-4701 Email: support@tiaranetworks.com
tiaraHssiMib.description: MIB definitions for Tiara HSSI modules.

hssiConfigTable.name: hssiConfigTable
hssiConfigTable.description: The HSSI interface configurable parameters are listed in this table.

hssiIfIndex.name: hssiIfIndex
hssiIfIndex.description: An integer value that is an index in the entries of the ifTable (MIB-II) with a HSSI interface type.

hssiConfigClockRate.name: hssiConfigClockRate
hssiConfigClockRate.description: Configures the clock rate (in Hertz) for the HSSI interface.

hssiConfigClockSource.name: hssiConfigClockSource
hssiConfigClockSource.description: Configures the clock source for the HSSI interface to either internal or line.

hssiConfigTxClockSource.name: hssiConfigTxClockSource
hssiConfigTxClockSource.description: Configures the transmit clock source for the HSSI interface to either internal or terminal. This variable is valid only for the HSSI interface on the USSI card.

hssiConfigRxClockSource.name: hssiConfigRxClockSource
hssiConfigRxClockSource.description: Configures the receive clock source for the HSSI interface to either internal or terminal. This variable is valid only for the HSSI interface on the USSI card

hssiConfigMode.name: hssiConfigMode
hssiConfigMode.description: Configures the mode for the HSSI to either DCE or DTE.

hssiConfigDataMode.name: hssiConfigDataMode
hssiConfigDataMode.description: Configures the data mode for the HSSI interface. This variable is valid only for the HSSI interface on the USSI card.

hssiConfigCRC.name: hssiConfigCRC
hssiConfigCRC.description: Configures the cyclic redundancy check for the HSSI interface to either 16 or 32 bits.

hssiConfigProcessCtrlSignal.name: hssiConfigProcessCtrlSignal
hssiConfigProcessCtrlSignal.description: Configures the processing of control signals (CA/TA) for the HSSI interface. This variable is valid only for the HSSI interface on the USSI card.

hssiDteLoopback.name: hssiDteLoopback
hssiDteLoopback.description: Configures the local DTE for loopback operation: TRUE : request local DTE to go into line loopback FALSE : request local DTE to abandon line loopback These commands are valid only if the HSSI adaptor is in DCE mode and connected to a local DTE. Since the local DTE has a greater loopback priority than the local DCE, a loopback request initiated by the DCE will be ignored if the DTE simultaneously requests the DCE to loopback. Similarly, the DTE will abort a loopback already initiated by the DCE when the DTE requests the DCE to loopback.

hssiDceLoopbackTest.name: hssiDceLoopbackTest
hssiDceLoopbackTest.description: Configures the local/remote DCE for loopback operation. Three DCE loopback modes are available: line, cable, and remote. Use noTest to abandon any of the DCE loopbacks. If the DCE is already in any one of the loopback modes, then noTest must be issued to abort the current test before initiating another loopback request. These commands are valid only if the HSSI adaptor is in DTE mode and it connected to a DCE.

hssiStatsTable.name: hssiStatsTable
hssiStatsTable.description: The HSSI interface status parameters are listed in this table.

hssiStatsAlarmStatus.name: hssiStatsAlarmStatus
hssiStatsAlarmStatus.description: Specifies the status of the HSSI alarm. If the particular bit is set, then it indicates that the alarm is in ON state. Alarm bits are mode dependent; they are interpreted as follows: hssi-alarms-CA - CA not received from DCE (HSSI is DTE) hssi-alarms-ST - HSSI adaptor driving ST (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-TM - TM received from DCE (HSSI is DTE) hssi-alarms-LC - HSSI adaptor detects LC (HSSI is DTE) hssi-alarms-LC - HSSI adaptor driving LC (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-TA - TA not received from DTE (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-LALB - HSSI adaptor detects LA and/or LB (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-LALB - HSSI adaptor driving LA and/or LB (HSSI is DTE)

hssiStatsFramesIn.name: hssiStatsFramesIn
hssiStatsFramesIn.description: Specifies the number of incoming frames.

hssiStatsFramesOut.name: hssiStatsFramesOut
hssiStatsFramesOut.description: Specifies the number of outgoing frames.

hssiStatsOctetsIn.name: hssiStatsOctetsIn
hssiStatsOctetsIn.description: Specifies the number of incoming octets.

hssiStatsOctetsOut.name: hssiStatsOctetsOut
hssiStatsOctetsOut.description: Specifies the number of outgoing octets.

hssiStatsCRCErrors.name: hssiStatsCRCErrors
hssiStatsCRCErrors.description: Specifies the number of CRC errors that have been identified.

hssiAlarmType.name: hssiAlarmType
hssiAlarmType.description: Specifies the type of alarm generated by the agent for the HSSI interface. Alarms are mode dependent; they are interpreted as follows: hssi-alarms-CA - CA not received from DCE (HSSI is DTE) hssi-alarms-ST - HSSI adaptor driving ST (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-TM - TM received from DCE (HSSI is DTE) hssi-alarms-LC - HSSI adaptor detects LC (HSSI is DTE) hssi-alarms-LC - HSSI adaptor driving LC (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-TA - TA not received from DTE (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-LALB - HSSI adaptor detects LA and/or LB (HSSI is DCE) hssi-alarms-LALB - HSSI adaptor driving LA and/or LB (HSSI is DTE)

hssiAlarmOnTrap.name: hssiAlarmOnTrap
hssiAlarmOnTrap.description: HSSI alarm traps for the Alarm-On state.

hssiAlarmOffTrap.name: hssiAlarmOffTrap
hssiAlarmOffTrap.description: HSSI alarm traps for the Alarm-Off state.
